early_stage:
EARLY STAGE — COHORT

What will go wrong
* Number systems concepts will be incorrectly applied, leading to calculation errors.
* Vocabulary confusion and misinterpretation will impact reading comprehension and verbal accuracy.
* Inability to arrange sentences logically will create paragraph coherence issues in exams.

What exactly to fix
* Review number properties, LCM/HCF, and divisibility rules with varied problems.
* Enhance vocabulary through contextual usage and synonym/antonym exercises daily.
* Practice identifying topic sentences and logical connectors for coherent paragraph construction.
midcourse_stage:
MID-COURSE STAGE — CC Batch 1

What will go wrong
* Persisting Number System issues will hinder advanced quant topics.
* Vocabulary gaps and RC errors will impact overall verbal scores.
* P&C struggles and overthinking will lead to calculation errors.

What exactly to fix
* Dedicate extra time to number properties and divisibility rules
* Consistent contextual vocabulary building and usage practice needed.
* Focus on permutation and combination formula selection and question mapping
preexam_stage:
PRE-EXAM STAGE — COHORT

What will go wrong
* Permutations & Combinations will cause major cohort-level score drop.
* Time management skills shaky; multiple topics will drag down overall attempt rate.
* RC inference and vocab questions will be a low-accuracy, high-time-spent zone.

What exactly to fix
* Drill P&C formula selection in complex, constraint-based questions.
* Practice efficient timer management; do rapid topic-switching drills.
* Teach quick RC inference tactics; use context to boost vocab recall.
